module.p:
Ergonymic name-descriptions are name-descriptions which are also ergonyms – specified common noun phrases which name groups of people – teams, organisations, institutions, companies, clans, etc. –
Eaglais na h-Alba The Church of Scotland
An Eaglais Stèidhichte The Established Church
Na Manaich Liatha The Greyfriars

section.p:
The head (ie. initial) noun in a (post-specified) ergonymic name-description which is itself the (genitive) (post-)specifier of another noun is traditionally not lenited –
ceannard Bòrd na Gàidhlig the chairman of Bòrd na Gàidhlig
prìomh oifis Banca Shasainn the Bank of England headquarters

However, lenition of ergonymic name-descriptions is more frequent in modern Gaelic usage than in traditional usage, possibly influenced by Standard Irish –
ceannard Bhòrd na Gàidhlig the chairman of Bòrd na Gàidhlig
prìomh oifis Bhanca Shasainn the Bank of England headquarters
